An indication of character growth. A character's level (Lv) increases
when a certain amount of experience is gained, also <color=#95C7FF>increasing their stats</color>.

There are 6 types of character stats:
・HP
・Phys. Attack (PATK)
・Mag. Attack (MATK)
・Phys. Defense (PDEF)
・Mag. Defense (MDEF)
・Healing Potency (HEAL)

Weapons each have a Level and Rarity, which determines their Stats and 
Abilities accordingly. 
You can <color=#95C7FF>Enhance Weapons</color> to <color=#95C7FF>improve their Stats</color>
and <color=#95C7FF>unlock or strengthen Abilities</color>.

The Stats and Abilities of a Weapon are applied to the character 
when the Weapon is equipped.
The types of Weapons that can be equipped as a 'Main Weapon' or 
'Ability Weapon' vary for each character.

Main weapons are <color=#95C7FF>visually displayed as the character's equipment</color> during battle.
Equipping it has the following effects.

To the equipped character:
 *Weapon's stats are reflected.
 *<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities become usable</color>.
 *<color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities are reflected</color>.

Equipped Materia:
 *The Materia's <color=#95C7FF>S. Abilities become usable</color>.

Ability weapons, when equipped, have the following effects.

Character:
・<color=#95C7FF>50% of the weapon's stats are reflected</color>.
・<color=#95C7FF>The C. Ability can be used during battle</color>.
・<color=#95C7FF>50% of the R. Ability pts are reflected</color>.

<color=#95C7FF>Sub Weapons</color>, when equipped, have the following effects.

Character:
 *<color=#95C7FF>50% of the weapon's stats are reflected</color>.
 *<color=#95C7FF>50% of the R. Ability pts are reflected</color>.

Unlike a main weapon and ability weapon, <color=#95C7FF>sub weapons</color> can be
equipped no matter the type.

<color=#95C7FF>Materia</color>, when equipped, has the following effects:

Character:
 *<color=#95C7FF>The sub stats of the Materia are reflected</color>.
 *<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities can be used in battle</color>.

Up to 3 <color=#95C7FF>Materia</color> can be equipped per character.

Support Materia are non-removable Materia in a set of 3 per weapon.
The effects are unlocked sequentially as the weapon is enhanced and
the conditions are met.

The <color=#95C7FF>S. Abilities</color> of Support Materia also have <color=#95C7FF>an effect
on the Materia that is equipped in pair</color>. 
Depending on the combination of Materia, the S. Abilities may not activate.

<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities (Command Abilities)</color> can be used by consuming the ATB Gauge during battle. 
C. Abilities come in two types: <color=#95C7FF>physical</color> and <color=#95C7FF>magic</color>. 
The damage dealt by an ability is determined based on the relevant stats for its type. 

Some examples include: 
Physical: Fast Blade, Ruinra Smash, etc 
Magic: Fire, Thunder, Blizzard, etc

Among the C. Abilities, there are those like Blizzaga A, which have an <color=#95C7FF>'A'</color> indicated
behind the ability name.

These are abilities that have <color=#95C7FF>broadened their range of effect</color>. 
Depending on the effect, they exert their effect on all characters or all enemies.

<color=#95C7FF>L. Abilities (Limit Abilities)</color> can be used by consuming the Limit gauge during battles.
You can choose to equip either a character's unique <color=#95C7FF>Limit Break</color> or a <color=#95C7FF>Summon Ability</color>
that cannot be duplicated within the same party.

<color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities (Reinforcement Abilities)</color> have a <color=#95C7FF>continuous effect during battle</color>.
The R. Ability Lv. is determined by the total points of the same effect R. Abilities
included in the character's equipment, and will adjust according to Lv.

<color=#95C7FF>S. Abilities (Support Abilities)</color> affect <color=#95C7FF>the materia paired with the support materia</color>.
To unleash their effects, the support materia of the main weapon must be unlocked.
Also, depending on the combination of materia, some effects may not be activated.

HP (Hit Points) indicate the amount of damage a character can withstand.
HP decreases when the character is attacked by an enemy.
When a character's HP reaches 0, they become unable to fight.
The game is over when all party members become unable to fight.

The attack power when attacking physically. The higher the Phys. Attack,
the more the <color=#95C7FF>damage of the physical ability</color> increases.

The attack power referenced when attacking with magic. 
The higher the Mag. Attack, the more the <color=#95C7FF>damage of magic type abilities</color> increases.

The defense strength against physical attacks. 
The higher the Phys. Defense, the less <color=#95C7FF>damage will be taken
from physical attacks</color>.

The defense strength against magic attacks. 
The higher the Mag. Defense, the less <color=#95C7FF>damage will be taken
from magical attacks</color>.

The strength of recovery abilities. 
The higher the Healing Potency, <color=#95C7FF>the more the effect of the recovery ability
increases</color>.

Affects the potency of abilities that have specific elements. 
If you have <color=#95C7FF>Boost Fire Pot.</color>, 
the damage of <color=#95C7FF>Fire abilities</color> will increase.

The defense against specific elements. 
If a character has <color=#95C7FF>Fire Resist.</color>, 
the <color=#95C7FF>damage from fire attribute attacks</color> they receive will be reduced.

A resistance to specific status ailments. 
If you have <color=#95C7FF>Poison Resist.</color>, 
you will be <color=#95C7FF>less likely to get poisoned when attacked by poison</color>.

When using <color=#95C7FF>non-elemental attack abilities</color>, 
there is a chance of a <color=#95C7FF>critical hit occurring</color>.

The higher the <color=#95C7FF>Boost Crit. Pot.</color> value, 
the more damage will be dealt when a critical hit occurs.
The higher the critical hit rate, the more likely a critical will occur.

A combination of characters and equipment for battle.
You can form parties for Solo and Co-op play.

A solo party is used to challenge <color=#95C7FF>solo content quests and dungeons</color>.

A co-op party is used to challenge <color=#95C7FF>co-op battles</color>. 
For story quests, the party will be automatically pre-made.

Power is <color=#95C7FF>a numerical value that serves as a rough measure of strength</color>,
calculated based on the stats and abilities of a character and their equipment.

The Total Power is the sum of the power of all characters currently in your party.
This serves as an indicator for challenging battles.

Rcmd. Party can automatically put together a party with optimized equipment. 
If you use Rcmd. Party just before <color=#95C7FF>challenging Solo Content or a Co-op Battle</color>, 
the party will be formed considering the <color=#95C7FF>recommended elements and sigils
for the battle</color>.

Best Equipment can automatically pick the equipment for your character displayed
on the Character screen.

The character displayed as Leader will be the <color=#95C7FF>character you control
at the start of battle</color>.

Multiple party compositions can be formed and saved.
Previously formed party information can also be copy and pasted into a different party
fomation slot.

A <color=#95C7FF>Limit Break</color>, a <color=#95C7FF>character-specific special move</color>,
can be activated as the <color=#95C7FF>Limit Gauge</color> fills up during battle.
By selecting and equipping one of the available <color=#95C7FF>Limit Breaks</color> for the character,
it can be used during battle.

When equipped instead of Limit Break,
it can be activated during battle as the <color=#95C7FF>Summon gauge accumulates</color>,
instead of the Limit gauge.

Even if multiple Summon Abilities have already been acquired,
the same summon cannot be equipped on more than one character in the same party.

This is a character's gear. If you own the gear of the relevant character,
you can change the gear on the set screen.

When assigning gear to a character, it will affect both the character's appearance
and their R. Ability pts.

There are two ways to enhance a character.

- By <color=#95C7FF>raising a character's level</color>, all stats are increased.

- By <color=#95C7FF>unlocking nodes on the Character Stream</color>, each stat can be
enhanced individually, and the character's Limit Break can be enhanced.

By consuming special items to unlock nodes, you can enhance a character's <color=#95C7FF>stats</color> and
strengthen <color=#95C7FF>obtained Limit Breaks</color>. 
It is also possible to obtain new Limit Breaks.

Activate a node on the Character Stream using a dedicated item. 
This is usually done by using a Memory dedicated to the designated character.

Items used to unlock nodes in each character's Character Stream.
Character-specific items can only be used in the Character Stream of the 
respective character.

A mission to obtain a Limit Break.

By completing all of the requirements, you will obtain a Limit Break.
<color=#95C7FF>Only one Limit Break mission can be in progress at a time per character.</color>
You cannot attempt multiple Limit Break Missions at the same time.

When you change the Limit Break Mission, a <color=#95C7FF>cooldown period</color> will occur
for each character. During the cooldown period, you will not be able to switch
between Limit Break Missions.

By clearing Summon Missions, a <color=#95C7FF>Pact</color> can be formed with the Summon
to acquire new Summon Abilities. 
After forming a pact, you can <color=#95C7FF>unlock nodes by consuming special items</color> and
<color=#95C7FF>enhance Summon Abilities</color>.

This item unlocks a node on a Summon Stream. Items specific to a summon can
only be used on the corresponding Summon Stream.

This is a mission to bind a Summon or acquire Summon Abilities.

By fulfilling all the conditions, you can create a <color=#95C7FF>new pact with a Summon</color>
and <color=#95C7FF>acquire Summon Abilities</color>. 
Only one Summon mission can be carried out for all Summons, 
and you cannot challenge multiple at the same time.

When you change the Summon mission, a cooldown will occur for all Summons. 
During the cooldown period, you will not be able to switch between
Summon Missions.

By consuming weapon enhancement materials, you can raise the level of
your weapon. 
As the weapon level increases, each of its stats will also increase. 
When you reach the max level, any excess experience will be returned to you as
enhancement materials.

You can increase the Max. level of a weapon via <color=#95C7FF>uncap level</color>
by using special items. 
Weapons that have their level uncapped will have their <color=#95C7FF>Max. level increased
and can be further enhanced</color>.

The number of times you can uncap depends on the weapon's rarity,
with higher rarities having higher Max. levels.

By uncapping, you can gradually unlock and enhance R. Abilities, 
and unlock Support Materia.

When enhancing weapons, a <color=#95C7FF>'Critical Success'</color> may occasionally occur,
allowing you to gain more EXP.

Weapons have three levels of rarity: 3★, 4★, and 5★. 
The higher the rarity, the higher the weapon's stats and ability effects.

There are two ways to upgrade a weapon's rarity:

- If you acquire the same weapon from a Draw or as a reward and it has a higher rarity
than the one you already own, it will be <color=#95C7FF>automatically upgraded</color>.
- You can also upgrade rarity by using a special item on a weapon you already own
in the enhancement screen.
This allows you to <color=#95C7FF>upgrade rarity at will</color>.

When upgrading rarity, the weapon's current level will be carried over.

5★ weapons can be pushed beyond their limits by using <color=#95C7FF>weapon parts</color>
specific to each weapon.

Depending on the weapon's <color=#95C7FF>Overboost</color> level, 
weapon stats, C. Abilities and R. Abilities can be enhanced.

By consuming <color=#95C7FF>Materia enhancement materials</color> or <color=#95C7FF>other Materia</color>, 
you can enhance your Materia and increase its level. 

As the Materia's Level is increased, the abilities will be enhanced, 
and <color=#95C7FF>Sub Stats will also be unlocked and increased</color>.

Materia that have reached their maximum level can be further enhanced by consuming items. 
Enhanced Materia will become higher-tier Materia, and their abilities will be <color=#95C7FF>enhanced</color>. 
Additionally, their maximum level will be increased, becoming even more powerful. 

The Materia's <color=#95C7FF>rarity</color> may increase when it is <color=#95C7FF>enhanced</color>.

When you obtain a <color=#95C7FF>synthesis recipe</color> for a Materia,
you can <color=#95C7FF>create it at will</color> by using the necessary materials.
Obtaining this allows you to synthesize the corresponding Materia.

During synthesis, you have the option to select <color=#95C7FF>additional materials</color>.
Some materials may affect the <color=#95C7FF>rarity</color> of the completed Materia.

After starting the synthesis, it will take time for the Materia to be completed. 
You can check the estimated synthesis time when selecting a recipe. 
The actual synthesis time is determined randomly at the start of the synthesis,
and you can check the remaining time on the synthesis screen. 

You can reduce the synthesis time with a <color=#95C7FF>Bookmark</color>.
An item that can shorten the required synthesis time.

Materia will randomly receive up to 4 sub-stats. 

The sub-stats that are shown as ??? will be gradually unlocked as the Materia's level increases. 
If all 4 stat slots are filled and a certain level is reached,
<color=#95C7FF>1 of the 4 stats will be enhanced at random</color>.

Materia rarity ranges from 1★ to 5★. 
The higher the rarity, the higher the effect of the Materia's ability.

It's possible to play through the Story for each title.

In the Story, battles may occur within episodes, or you may explore Dungeons.

By clearing the episode and progressing the section, 
you can proceed to the next chapter when all sections are cleared.

This is a mode where you challenge quests using a <color=#95C7FF>Story Quest Party</color>. 
The party members will be fixed for each episode.

By clearing this mode, you can earn <color=#95C7FF>1st Clear Rewards</color>. 
It is possible to play the same quests repeatedly,
but rewards can only be received on the <color=#95C7FF>first clear</color>.
If you lose a battle in the story, you can resume from before the battle started. 
At that time, the stats of the party members will return to the state before the battle started.

Challenge quests with a <color=#95C7FF>party of your choice</color>. 
The number of characters usable is subject to the same restrictions as the Story Party.

Clearing this mode will still count as completing the episode, and allow you to progress
through the story.
Challenge battles in the story using either of the two party modes.

You can temporarily suspend your game during the story.
Tap Suspend in the menu while progressing through the story to pause the game.

View a log of all of the dialogue in the scene.
Tap Conversation Log in the menu to display it.

Skip the current scene.
Tap the skip button on the right side of the screen.
If there is a battle or an upcoming choice, the story will be skipped up to that point.

Automatically load the text in the scene.
Tap the auto button on the right side of the screen to enable this function.

Dungeons are a general term for the fields where players control their characters.

In dungeons, you aim to clear by advancing the map while solving gimmicks, battling,
and opening chests.

Approach and tap to receive rewards.
In <color=#95C7FF>story mode dungeons</color>, rewards can only be obtained once.

Within dungeons, you can freely move your character.
There are two ways to move; <color=#95C7FF>sliding</color> and/or <color=#95C7FF>tapping</color>.

When sliding your finger across the screen, a virtual pad will appear,
and your character will move in the corresponding direction.

When you tap a walkable area, your character will move towards that point.
While moving across a <color=#95C7FF>dungeon</color>, players may encounter a battle.

In story mode dungeons, after each <color=#95C7FF>battle</color>, the character's <color=#95C7FF>HP is restored to 100%</color>.
If a character's HP reaches 0 and they become unable to fight,
they will also be restored in the same way.

Some states, such as the Limit gauge, are carried over to the next battle,
with the exception of characters who have become unable to fight.

There are various types of traps in the <color=#95C7FF>Dungeons</color>.
Operate them by getting close and tapping.

When you clear a chapter, you'll be able to challenge <color=#95C7FF>EXTRA</color> battles.

These are high-difficulty battle contents where the bosses that appeared in the same chapter
will <color=#95C7FF>reappear even stronger</color>.

If you replay a previously completed episode,
you will not be able to receive battle rewards (including EXP).

Chests in the dungeon that have already been opened once will also be marked as obtained.

In battle, characters will <color=#95C7FF>automatically</color> attack enemies with their weapons at regular intervals.
You can activate abilities while monitoring the situation to prevent characters from becoming
incapacitated. Victory is achieved by reducing all enemies' <color=#95C7FF>HP to 0</color>.

Enemies may appear in <color=#95C7FF>multiple waves</color>, 
and victory is achieved by progressing to the final wave and defeating all enemies.

*If there is a boss, victory is achieved by defeating the boss.

The ATB gauge <color=#95C7FF>increases over time</color>.
The gauge will stop increasing during enemy appearances,
and when the menu is open during battles. 
You can <color=#95C7FF>use C. Ability</color> by consuming the ATB gauge.

There are abilities that can be activated during battle, some of which the player can <color=#95C7FF>activate
manually</color>, and some that will <color=#95C7FF>automatically activate</color>.

・Abilities that the player can manually activate: <color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities, L. Abilities</color>
・Abilities that automatically activate in battle: <color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities, S. Abilities</color>

<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities and L. Abilities</color> are abilities that can be manually activated during battle
by consuming the <color=#95C7FF>ATB Gauge and the Limit Gauge</color> respectively.

They have various effects, such as attack, healing, stat enhancement, and status ailments. 
For elemental attacks, the damage varies depending on whether the target's weakness or
resistance is hit.

<color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities and S. Abilities</color> are abilities that <color=#95C7FF>automatically take effect</color> during battles.

R. Abilities often directly influence a <color=#95C7FF>character's stats</color>.
S. Abilities affect the effects of a <color=#95C7FF>Materia's C. Ability</color>.

There are 2 types of Command Stance: <color=#95C7FF>Attack or Defense</color>.

You can freely switch between them by <color=#95C7FF>tapping the Command icon</color> on the right side
of the screen during battles.

By maintaining a high Command Gauge, you can utilize their effects throughout the battle.

<color=#95C7FF>Attack Stance</color> is a command specialized for offense.

・The <color=#95C7FF>damage dealt by the character increases</color>.
・All attack command abilities allow you to <color=#95C7FF>destroy the enemy's Sigil</color>.
・In the case of a Sigil-matching ability, the number of <color=#95C7FF>Sigils destroyed will increase</color>.

During <color=#95C7FF>Attack Stance</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>Command Gauge increases</color>, and the effect increases when
the gauge is at its maximum.
The actions of your allies will also become more attack-oriented.

<color=#95C7FF>Defense Stance</color> is a command specialized for defending against enemies' attacks.

・The <color=#95C7FF>damage received by the character decreases</color>.
・The character's <color=#95C7FF>healing power increases</color>.

During <color=#95C7FF>Defense Stance</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>Command Gauge decreases</color>, and the effect decreases when
the gauge is at its minimum.
The actions of your allies will also become more defense and recovery oriented.

<color=#95C7FF>Limit Breaks and Summon abilities</color> have powerful effects, but their gauge must be charged
in order to activate them. 
The required gauge amount varies depending on each Limit Breaks and Summon abilities. 
<color=#95C7FF>When the gauge is charged, you can activate it at any time</color>.

The gauge will not be activated automatically during auto mode or by party members. 
There is no limit to the number of times it can be activated during battles.

When controlling characters equipped with <color=#95C7FF>Limit Break</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>Limit Gauge</color> will be displayed, 
which accumulates based on their actions during battles.

The <color=#95C7FF>Limit Gauge</color> increases when you <color=#95C7FF>use C. Abilities</color>, or <color=#95C7FF>take damage from enemies</color>.

Characters equipped with a <color=#95C7FF>Summon Ability</color> will switch their Limit Gauge to the <color=#95C7FF>Summon
Gauge</color>. 

The Summon Gauge, like the Limit Gauge,
increases when you <color=#95C7FF>use a C. Ability</color> or <color=#95C7FF>receive damage from enemies</color>.

Using Limit Break and Summon Ability continuously with party characters will result in
a <color=#95C7FF>Limit Combo</color>. 

Depending on the number of combos, a bonus multiplier will be applied to
the <color=#95C7FF>damage of each activated ability</color>.

Enemies may have <color=#95C7FF>attributes that serve as weaknesses or resistances</color>. 
Attacking with an attribute that is a weakness <color=#95C7FF>increases the damage dealt to the enemy</color>. 
Attacking with an attribute that is a resistance <color=#95C7FF>reduces or absorbs the damage dealt</color>. 
The degree of weakness or resistance varies depending on the enemy. 
If the character you are controlling has an ability that corresponds to the enemy's weakness,
<color=#95C7FF>the attribute icon of the ability will glow</color>.

During battles, <color=#95C7FF>switch your attack target</color> by tapping the name displayed above the enemy. 
Party members will also aim at the targeted enemy. 
*In a Co-op Battle, this will only affect you.

There are bosses that enter a special state called a <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>.
When <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color> is activated, 
a gauge that indicates the start and end will appear at the top of the battle screen.
The following are some of the main effects during the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>:

・During the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>, there may be <color=#95C7FF>continuous advantageous effects</color> that benefit the
enemy.
・During the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>enemy's behavior</color> may change.
・When the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color> ends, the enemy may use a <color=#95C7FF>powerful technique</color>.

The icon displayed with numbers below the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color> gauge.
Some <color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities</color> of weapons and Materia also have <color=#95C7FF>Sigils</color>.

If attacking with an ability that matches the displayed <color=#95C7FF>Sigil</color>, it becomes a '<color=#95C7FF>Sigil Breaker</color>' and
the number decreases. 
Even if the ability does not match the <color=#95C7FF>Sigil</color>,
you can still perform a <color=#95C7FF>Sigil Breaker</color> if in <color=#95C7FF>Attack Stance</color>.

During the stream phase, if you destroy all the <color=#95C7FF>Sigils</color> and reduce the number to 0,
the stream phase will be forcibly terminated, and an <color=#95C7FF>Interruption</color> will occur.
During the Interruption, the following effects occur:

・The fill rate of the <color=#95C7FF>ATB gauge</color> will increase.
・The effect of the <color=#95C7FF>Command Abilities</color> will be maximized.
・The <color=#95C7FF>enemy</color> will stop moving.

In addition, by destroying Sigils quickly, bonus time will be added to the Interruption.

By tapping the character icon displayed on the left side of the screen,
you can <color=#95C7FF>switch the character you are controlling</color>.

If the controlled character becomes incapacitated, the controlled character will 
automatically switch to another party member. 
A character who has become incapacitated cannot be revived during battle. 
If all party members become incapacitated, the battle will be lost. 

In some battles, you may be able to use Red Crystals or Blue Crystals to continue 
after losing.

Battles have a time limit. If the time limit expires, the battle will end forcibly,
and it will be game over. 
You can check the remaining time at any point during a battle by opening the Menu.

*This applies to all battles regardless of the content, such as Story, quests, Dungeons,
and Co-op Battles. 
*Excluding the time when the Menu is open.
(In Co-op Battle, time passes even when the Menu is open.)
If you exit the app during a battle, you can resume that battle when you restart the app.

You can switch between the following 3 modes to control characters during battle:

・<color=#95C7FF>MANUAL</color>
All actions are performed manually by the player.

・<color=#95C7FF>SEMI AUTO</color>
The controlled character will use <color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities automatically when the ATB gauge is full</color>.

・<color=#95C7FF>AUTO</color>
All actions with exception of <color=#95C7FF>Limit Breaks are performed automatically</color>.

It's possible to speed up the flow of battle.
The interval between automatic weapon attacks, the rate at which the ATB gauge fills, 
and the movement speeds of characters and enemies will all be <color=#95C7FF>doubled</color>.

However, this does not apply to certain attacks used by some enemies, 
L. Abilities, and other instances where time temporarily stops.

During battle, beneficial effects called <color=#95C7FF>buffs</color> and harmful effects called <color=#95C7FF>debuffs</color> can be applied
to enemies and characters.

Some buffs and debuffs have tiers.
You can check the details of the buff and debuff icons from the <sprite="tmp_icon" index=835> button.

When <color=#95C7FF>the same type of buff or debuff</color> as a target's current buff or debuff is applied, 
its <color=#95C7FF>tier is raised</color> and <color=#95C7FF>duration extended</color>.

The maximum tier and duration of buffs and debuffs differ with each ability.

When the opposite type of buff or debuff as a target's current buff or debuff is applied,
its <color=#95C7FF>tier is lowered</color> and <color=#95C7FF>duration reduced</color>.

Status ailment debuffs can be removed after a certain amount of time has passed or with
specific abilities.

Some Buffs and Debuffs cannot be increased, decreased, or removed. 
Buffs and Debuffs that cannot be increased,
decreased, or removed are displayed with different colors and frames as follows:

<sprite="tmp_icon" index=324>Boost PATK
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=606>Boost PATK (Cannot be increased, decreased, or removed)

Some enemies may have resistance to certain debuffs. 
Debuffs that lower elemental resistance only have an effect on enemies that have that
element as a weakness.

- Increased Stats
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=324>Phys. Attack Up: Phys. Attack is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=323>Phys. Defense Up: Phys. Defense is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=326>Mag. Attack Up: Mag. Attack is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=325>Mag. Defense Up: Mag. Defense is increased.

- Increased Stats (Elemental Potency Up)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=578>Fire Pot. Up: Damage of Fire Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=576>Ice Pot. Up: Damage of Ice Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=612>Lightning Pot. Up: Damage of Lightning Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=579>Earth Pot. Up: Damage of Earth Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=611>Water Pot. Up: Damage of Water Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=610>Wind Pot. Up: Damage of Wind Abilities is increased.

- Increased Stats (Elemental Damage Up)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=328>Fire Pot. Up: Damage of Fire Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=329>Ice Pot. Up: Damage of Ice Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=330>Lightning Pot. Up: Damage of Lightning Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=331>Earth Pot. Up: Damage of Earth Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=332>Water Pot. Up: Damage of Water Abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=333>Wind Pot. Up: Damage of Wind Abilities is increased.

- Increased Stats (Resist. Up)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=594>Phys. Resist. Up: Phys. Damage taken is reduced.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=595>Mag. Resist. Up: Mag. Damage taken is reduced.

- Increased Stats (Elemental Resist. Up)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=602>Fire Resist. Up: Damage from Fire Abilities is reduced.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=600>Ice Resist. Up: Damage from Ice Abilities is reduced.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=599>Lightning Resist. Up: Damage from Lightning Abilities is reduced.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=603>Earth Resist. Up: Damage from Earth Abilities is reduced.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=598>Water Resist. Up: Damage from Water Abilities is reduced.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=597>Wind Resist. Up: Damage from Wind Abilities is reduced.

- Status Changes
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=321>Regen: HP is gradually restored.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=322>Invincible: Less Damage is taken.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=327>Haste: The ATB gauge fills faster. If Slow is granted, it is removed.

- Decreased Stats
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=388>Phys. Attack Down: Phys. Attack is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=387>Phys. Defense Down: Phys. Defense is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=390>Mag. Attack Down: Mag. Attack is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=389>Mag. Defense Down: Mag. Defense is decreased.

- Decreased Stats (Elemental Potency Down)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=702>Fire Pot. Down: Damage of Fire abilities is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=707>Ice Pot. Down: Damage of Ice abilities is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=706>Lightning Pot. Down: Damage of Lightning abilities is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=703>Earth Pot. Down: Damage of Earth abilities is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=705>Water Pot. Down: Damage of Water abilities is decreased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=694>Wind Pot. Down: Damage of Wind abilities is decreased.

- Decreased Stats (Resist. Down)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=678>Phys. Resist. Down: Phys. type damage taken is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=679>Mag. Resist. Down: Mag. type damage taken is increased.

- Decreased Stats (Elemental Resist. Down)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=686>Fire Resist. Down: Damage from Fire abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=684>Ice Resist. Down: Damage from Ice abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=683>Lightning Resist. Down: Damage from Lightning abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=687>Earth Resist. Down: Damage from Earth abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=682>Water Resist. Down: Damage from Water abilities is increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=681>Wind Resist. Down: Damage from Wind abilities is increased.

- Status Changes (Character)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=395>Poison: HP gradually decreases.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=386>Darkness: Phys. type C. Abilities become unusable.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=393>Silence: Mag. type C. Abilities become unusable.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=384>Fatigue: When using Phys. type C. Abilities, the amount of ATB gauge consumed
　will be increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=385>Fog: When using Mag. type C. Abilities, the amount of ATB gauge consumed will
　be increased.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=392>Stun: Movement is restricted, and the ATB gauge will not increase.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=394>Sedate: The Limit/Summon gauges become harder to fill up.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=396>Confusion: When using an ability, there is a chance of a character attacking themself.
　Upon attacking themself, confusion has a chance of being dispelled.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=397>Sleep: Incapacitates a character, increasing the damage they will receive next.
　It is lifted upon recieving damage.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=399>Slow: The ATB gauge fills more slowly. If Haste is granted, it is removed.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=398>Block Rec.: Healing C. abilities become unusable.

- Status Changes (Enemy)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=395>Poison: HP gradually decreases.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=386>Darkness: Phys. type abilities become unusable.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=393>Silence: Mag. type abilities become unusable.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=384>Fatigue: When using Phys. type abilities, waiting time is added.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=385>Fog: When using Mag. type abilities, waiting time is added.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=392>Stun: Movement is restricted, and the stream phase will be stopped.

This is a quest where you can easily obtain <color=#95C7FF>Character EXP</color> and <color=#95C7FF>materials for Enhance and
Synthesis</color>.

Form a Solo Party and engage in battles. If you win the battle,
you will clear the quest and can obtain Rewards.

Upon completing the quest, your score will be calculated based on the battle,
and your rank from F to S will be determined. 
The higher the rank, the more luxurious the completion rewards will be.

These are quests that can be completed to earn rewards, which are updated daily. 
Each quest can only be cleared once a day, and <color=#95C7FF>regardless of the completion status, 
the quests are refreshed at 12:00 PM PST daily</color>. 
*Daily quests do not consume stamina.

Some of the Daily Quests allow you to specify the <color=#95C7FF>rewards you want</color>. 
You need to choose five Rewards on the reward selection screen, 
and you will have a chance to obtain them through a lottery upon clearing the quest. 

Additionally, there are quests that offer more Rewards than usual, 
which are called <color=#95C7FF>Additional Special Rewards</color>.

When certain conditions are met, the quest requirements will rank up. 
The difficulty of the quest will increase, but so will the rewards obtained.

These quests allow you to battle with Summons. 

By clearing Summon Quests, you can obtain <color=#95C7FF>Summon weapons</color> and <color=#95C7FF>enhancement 
materials for Summons</color>. 
In addition, the <color=#95C7FF>Summon Stream of the target Summon</color> will be unlocked.
*Summon Quests consume a specific amount of stamina per quest.

If you are defeated in a quest battle,
you can choose to continue by consuming Red Crystals or Blue Crystals.

If you choose to continue, all party members will be fully recovered and the battle 
will resume. 
If you choose to retire without continuing,
it will result in a game over, and you will not be able to obtain any rewards.

This is a feature that allows you to <color=#95C7FF>consume multiple amounts of stamina</color> at once when
challenging a quest, 
and to <color=#95C7FF>acquire multiple rewards at once</color> by challenging it only once.
You can use it for quests that you have cleared once.

You can learn more about characters and their backstories through story quests.
 
*Story quests do not consume stamina.

In story quest battles, some <color=#95C7FF>characters may be fixed</color> in your party.
Story quest battles can be replayed,
but <color=#95C7FF>rewards are only granted when cleared for the first time.</color>

Content where up to 3 players match up to challenge the same battle. 
You can choose between a <color=#95C7FF>Private Match</color> to match with specific players and 
<color=#95C7FF>Random Match</color> to match randomly with anyone.

Players battle with a party composed of only one character for Co-op Battle. 
Win the battle to obtain rewards.
*In Co-op Battle, a certain amount of Stamina is consumed for each battle.

Clear Co-op Battles to get <color=#95C7FF>Co-op Medals</color> as a reward. 
The number of medals you can obtain will increase if you clear the battle with friends.

There is a limit to the number of Co-op Medals that can be obtained and held within a week. 
<color=#95C7FF>Co-op Medals</color> can be used at the Exchange.

It is possible to create a <color=#95C7FF>Lobby</color> to match with specific players only. 

To create a <color=#95C7FF>Lobby</color>, select the battle you want to challenge and select <color=#95C7FF>Private Match</color>.
The <color=#95C7FF>Lobby ID</color> will be displayed in the created <color=#95C7FF>Lobby</color>. 

Other players can enter the same <color=#95C7FF>Lobby</color> and battle together by entering the <color=#95C7FF>Lobby ID</color> 
in the <color=#95C7FF>Co-op Battle</color> menu. 
In a <color=#95C7FF>Private Match</color>, the battle can start when at least two players have gathered,
and all players select Ready.

You can change your settings to accept <color=#95C7FF>Random Matches</color> from the lobby details. 
*The default setting is off.

<color=#95C7FF>Match with players randomly</color> from across the globe.

To match with other players,
select the battle you want to challenge and choose <color=#95C7FF>Random Match</color>.

Wait for other players who want to take on the same battle,
and when three players are gathered, you can start the match. 
All players must select Ready in order to start the battle.

In Co-op Battles, there are <color=#95C7FF>Required Power</color> levels set for each battle, 
separate from the Recommended Power levels.

If you want to challenge a battle in a Random Match, 
the <color=#95C7FF>Total Power of your Co-op Party must exceed the Required Power of the battle 
you want to challenge</color>.

You can check the Required Power for Random Match in the stage details.

Upon quest completion, a score is calculated based on the battle content,
and a rank from F to S is determined. 
The higher the rank, the more luxurious the clear rewards become. 
Note that all players participating in the matching will receive the same score.

In the Battle Results, you can check the battle report,
which displays the player's actions in each category.

In the Battle Results, contribution titles are displayed according to the <color=#95C7FF>item each player
contributed the most</color> in the battle, 
such as damage dealt to the enemy, use of status increase/decrease abilities, etc.

In Co-op Battles, you can use <color=#95C7FF>Raise</color> to revive characters that have become incapacitated.

If a character on your team becomes incapacitated, the <color=#95C7FF>Raise</color> button will be displayed. 
Each player can use <color=#95C7FF>Raise</color> once on another player's character, 
but a character can only be revived once with a <color=#95C7FF>Raise</color>.

Using <color=#95C7FF>Raise</color> will consume ATB, just like a C. Ability.

In a Co-op Battle, Command Stance can be <color=#95C7FF>switched for each player</color>,
and the effect is only exerted on their own character.
 
If all three players are not incapacitated and they have <color=#95C7FF>matching commands</color>,
the effect will increase. 
The effect will not be activated when there are two or fewer players participating in the battle.

Players who have matched with each other can send pre-made messages during 
a battle or in lobby.

When creating a Lobby in a Private Match, the Lobby host can send <color=#95C7FF>invitations to friends</color>. 

Invited players can participate by selecting the Lobby from the <color=#95C7FF>Invitation List</color> in the
Co-op Battle menu.

If all of a player's characters become incapacitated, 
the player will have the option to continue. 
When one person chooses to continue, all player characters participating in the battle 
can be fully recovered and the battle can be resumed.

If all players chooses not to continue,
or when you can no longer continue, the game will be over. 
In Co-op Battle, you can continue up to three times.

When you <color=#95C7FF>clear a Co-op Battle with a player you are matching for the first time</color>,
you can receive a First-Time Match Reward.
From the 201st person onwards, even those who have not matched recently 
will be treated as a first match again.

Dungeons are content where the goal is to defeat the <color=#95C7FF>boss located at the deepest 
part of the dungeon</color>.
Types of dungeon include <color=#95C7FF>Criterion Dungeons</color>, where you aim to clear while challenging
missions, and <color=#95C7FF>Crisis Dungeon</color>, where you aim for a higher score when clearing.

In Dungeons, your character's <color=#95C7FF>HP Limit</color> decreases each time they take damage.
The decrease rate is a fixed percentage, 
depending on the enemy's abilities and the specific Dungeon.

The decreased HP Limit can be restored using <color=#95C7FF>special items</color> that can be obtained 
within the Dungeon.

In Dungeons, the following stats will be carried over between battles.
・HP
・HP Limit
・ATB Gauge
・Limit Gauge/Summon Gauge
・Command/Command Gauge

The following stats will not be carried over between battles, and will instead be lifted
(if incapacitated, the character will be revived with 1 HP).
・Any buff/debuff
・Status ailment
・Status effect
・KO status (incapacitated)

Each stage of the Criterion Dungeons has <color=#95C7FF>three missions</color>.
When you complete these missions, you can receive rewards upon clearing the dungeon.
Rewards for dungeon missions can only be obtained the first time you complete them.

This is a general term for bosses that you can battle by touching symbols within Dungeons.
If you win the <color=#95C7FF>boss battle</color> at the larger symbol located in the deepest part of the Dungeon,
you will complete the Dungeon.
The color of the symbol <color=#95C7FF>changes in comparison to the party's Power</color>.

Purple: The party's Power is low compared to the boss's Power.
Orange: The boss's Power is equal to the party's Power.
Yellow: The party's Power is higher than the boss's Power.

Additionally, Symbol Enemies of colors not mentioned above may be especially
powerful bosses.

In Dungeons, you may obtain <color=#95C7FF>items that can only be used within the dungeon</color>.
The effects of these items, such as maximum HP recovery and increase in Limit Gauge,
are useful for dungeon exploration.
Items that can only be used within the dungeon will be lost once you transition to
the dungeon results, regardless of whether you clear or retire from the dungeon.

Unlike Story Dungeons, there are two types of chests in the dungeon:

<color=#95C7FF>Yellow chests</color> contain items that can only be used in the dungeon.
You can get them every time you challenge the dungeon.

<color=#95C7FF>Blue chests</color> correspond to 'Rare Chests'.
The rewards from this chest can only be obtained once.

You can check information about dungeons before challenging them,
or from Menu > Dungeons.

If you exit the app while progressing through a dungeon, your data will be temporarily saved.

When you select a dungeon with saved data, a confirmation dialogue to resume from
suspended data will be displayed, and you can resume from where you left off.

The suspended data will be discarded when you resume.

This term refers to buffs, debuffs, and other <color=#95C7FF>changes to your character's stats</color> that are in
constant effect in Crisis Dungeons.

Upon entrance, the initial Trance Ability for the dungeon will be activated. 
In addition, you can earn additional abilities by <color=#95C7FF>defeating Symbol Enemies</color> in the dungeon. 
You can choose 1 option out of other predetermined Trance Abilities.

You will consume one Dungeon Key each time you challenge the Crisis Dungeon.

Dungeon Keys are <color=#95C7FF>automatically replenished by 3 every Monday</color>,
and you can also exchange them for Crystals. 
There is a weekly limit to the number of exchanges.

When you defeat a <color=#95C7FF>Symbol Enemy</color> in a dungeon, 
your <color=#95C7FF>Crisis Level will increase</color>. 
As your <color=#95C7FF>Crisis Level increases</color>, 
the levels of your enemies, including Symbol enemies, will also increase. 
You can check your current Crisis Level by opening the dungeon menu.

In a Crisis Dungeon, your score will increase when you defeat Symbol Enemies or 
complete the dungeon.

Your battle performance affects the score when you <color=#95C7FF>defeat a Symbol Enemy</color>,
while your overall performance in defeating Symbol Enemies and <color=#95C7FF>consuming items</color> 
affects the score upon completing the dungeon.

Your rank is determined by your total score when you clear the dungeon,
and you will receive <color=#95C7FF>'First Time Achievement Rewards'</color> and <color=#95C7FF>'Achievement Rewards'</color>.

The <color=#95C7FF>First Time Achievement Reward</color> is a reward that can only be obtained once,
when you reach that rank for the first time. 
You can also simultaneously receive the first time rank rewards for ranks below the one 
you reached.

Achievement Rewards are rewards according to the rank you reached. 
You can always <color=#95C7FF>obtain them every time you clear the dungeon</color>.

This is content where you progress through stages one after another.  
The <color=#95C7FF>rewards for each battle are one-time only</color>, as you aim to reach further stages.

We plan to add stages periodically.

In the Tower, at the start of battles, effects that <color=#95C7FF>increase or decrease the stats and 
resistances</color> of all allies or enemies as targets are activated. 
Some effects persist until the end of the battle, while others have a limited duration.

In a <color=#95C7FF>New Weapon Featured Draw</color>, 
when you tap the <color=#95C7FF>'Draw 10 times'</color> button, 
a lottery animation will occur and a stamp will be pressed onto your Stamp Card. 
When a stamp is selected, you can <color=#95C7FF>obtain the reward of that square</color>.
 
*Please check the New Weapon Featured Draw details on the draw screen for the 
acquisition rate of Stamps.

There may be <color=#95C7FF>Select Squares</color> on the Stamp Card. 
In Select Squares, you can <color=#95C7FF>choose and specify the rewards you want from multiple options</color>. 
Even after making a selection, you can change it from the Stamp Card details as many times
as you want as long as you haven't obtained the corresponding reward yet.

In New Weapon Featured Draw, there is a feature called the <color=#95C7FF>Wishlist</color>. 
The drop rate of weapons registered in the <color=#95C7FF>Wishlist</color> will increase. 
You cannot select the same weapon multiple times. 
Registration is complete when you have set different weapons for all five <color=#95C7FF>Wishlist</color> slots. 
You can change your <color=#95C7FF>Wishlist</color> registration as many times as you want.

If you already possess a weapon that you obtained from Draws,
that weapon will be sent to the Armory.

If you obtain a weapon with a higher rarity than the one you already possess, 
the rarity of the weapon will increase,
and the weapon of lower rarity will be placed in the Armory.

The weapons in the Armory, which can be accessed from the Enhance Weapons screen, 
can be converted into <color=#95C7FF>weapon-specific Weapon Parts</color> used for Rarity Upgrades and Overboost.

Weapon-specific parts can be converted into <color=#95C7FF>Weapon Medals</color>,
which can be exchanged for various items at the Exchange.

In the Shop, you can purchase various items by spending Crystals or Gil. 
Some shops and items have limitations such as expiration dates or number of purchases.

At the Exchange, you can exchange items you own, such as Medals, for other items. 
Some Exchanges and items have limitations in terms of expiration dates or exchange quantities.

In some shops, the contents of the products will be automatically updated over time. 
Additionally, there are shops where players can manually update the content. 
There is a limit to the number of updates per day.

The amount you can purchase varies depending on your age:
Under 16 years old: Up to 5,000 yen per month
16-17 years old: Up to 30,000 yen per month
18 years old and above: No restrictions
Player age is counted in months, and the month after a birthday is reached is considered as
the current age.
Minors require approval from their legal guardian (parents, etc.) to make purchases.
Once you enter your date of birth, it cannot be changed.
You can use the Chocobos you've acquired to challenge various content.

By sending Chocobos along with characters on expeditions to <color=#95C7FF>Expedition Areas</color>, 
you can <color=#95C7FF>obtain items and Character EXP</color>.

After departing for an expedition, it takes time for rewards to be obtained.
The collection time and maximum collection count are determined by the Chocobo's stats.

This is an item that can shorten the time between starting an expedition and 
collecting rewards. 
There is a limit to the number of uses per day.

If the level of the character selected for the Tag Team of the expedition is lower than 
a certain threshold compared to the average level of the top 3 characters, 
a bonus is applied to the <color=#95C7FF>Character EXP</color> obtained during the expedition,
allowing you to earn more.
You can manage your Chocobos and check their abilities.

You can <color=#95C7FF>retire</color> Chocobos.

Retiring a Chocobo removes it from the Chocobo Stable, 
and it will never come back. 
You will receive <color=#95C7FF>Chocobo Medals</color> based on the rank of the retired Chocobo.

You cannot retire all of your Chocobos; there must always be at least one in
the Chocobo Stable.
If you Protect a Chocobo in the Chocobo Stable, you will not be able to retire it.
You can exchange <color=#95C7FF>Chocobo Medals obtained within the Chocobo Farm for Chocobos</color>.

By fulfilling the conditions set as missions, you can earn various rewards.

You can check the missions from the <color=#95C7FF>'Missions'</color> button on the home screen, 
and various missions can be checked from the <color=#95C7FF>menu within the home screen</color>.

<color=#95C7FF>Daily missions and Weekly missions</color> grant <color=#95C7FF>bonus points</color> when you complete them.

When you accumulate a certain number of bonus points, you can receive rewards.

These are beginner missions displayed on the home screen. 
When you complete a mission and claim its reward, a new mission will be displayed.

You can check and edit your own information.

・Check/edit Name
・Check/copy Player ID
・Set Profile Pieces
・Check/edit self-introduction
・Display play records

You can check your Friends and perform <color=#95C7FF>Friend Requests</color>, as well as accept them.

Players who become Friends can <color=#95C7FF>invite to Co-op Battles</color>, 
and some Rewards will increase by clearing Co-op Battles together.
You can receive in-game items and various rewards sent to the Gift Box.

Some items in the Gift Box have a <color=#95C7FF>expiration date</color>.
If the expiration date has passed, they will be <color=#95C7FF>automatically deleted</color>.

You can set the display of the obtained <color=#95C7FF>Wallpaper</color>.

If you set multiple Wallpapers in either Sequential Order or Random, 
the home screen background will change according to the set order at regular intervals.

If you only select and set one background, it will be fixed to the selected background.

The player name you set can be freely edited anytime from the profile in the menu.

*Player name registration is required.

When you clear battles by consuming Stamina, 
you can get Player EXP. 
When the EXP reaches a certain amount, your Player Lv. will increase. 
This can also increase the maximum Stamina and can be a requirement to
unlock certain content.

Stamina is consumed when attempting Enhancement Quests or Co-op Battle. 
If you lack the necessary stamina to attempt a battle, you cannot proceed.

Stamina naturally recovers over time. 
By tapping the value of stamina displayed at the top of the home screen, 
you can check the time until full recovery. 
If your current stamina is already at the maximum, natural recovery does not occur.

You can recover stamina by consuming Red Crystals/Blue Crystals 
or using stamina recovery items. 
The maximum limit for stamina that can be recovered using crystals and items is 999.

This is a reward that can be claimed once per day upon login. 
The reward contents vary daily based on the ongoing login bonus.

The reset timing for the login bonus is at 12:00 PM PST every day.
With the Season Pass, you can earn various rewards by completing <color=#95C7FF>Explorations</color>.

There are various conditions for Exploration, and you can progress by achieving them.

There are three types of Exploration, <color=#95C7FF>Daily Exploration</color>, <color=#95C7FF>Weekly Exploration</color>, 
<color=#95C7FF>Season Exploration</color>. Each is reset according to the period.

* Season Exploration may be added in the middle of the period.

Your <color=#95C7FF>Exploration Lv increases</color> as you progress in the Exploration.

With each increase in <color=#95C7FF>Exploration Lv</color>, you can <color=#95C7FF>obtain rewards</color> corresponding to that level.
*After your Exploration Lv increases, 
you can claim the rewards from the Season Pass screen.

You can also increase your Exploration Lv. by using Red Crystals/Blue Crystals. 
If you reach the maximum Exploration Lv. in this manner,
any surplus Exploration points will be discarded.

Season Pass rewards can be obtained through the <color=#95C7FF>Normal Hunt</color> and <color=#95C7FF>Premium Hunt</color>.

Your Exploration Lv. is shared across the <color=#95C7FF>Normal Hunt</color> and <color=#95C7FF>Premium Hunt</color>.

Normal Hunt is a hunt route that is <color=#95C7FF>unlocked from the beginning</color>. 
You can challenge it at the change of each season.

Unlike Normal Hunt, Premium Hunt is initially locked, but can be <color=#95C7FF>unlocked by purchasing</color>. 
Once unlocked, you can <color=#95C7FF>earn additional rewards</color> in Normal Hunt.
Premium Hunt switches per season. 
The purchase status of Premium Hunt will not be carried over when the season changes.
To receive the rewards of Premium Hunt in the new season, you will need to re-purchase.

Some rewards allow you to choose one from several.

Icons marked with <color=#95C7FF>SELECT</color> are selection rewards, 
and you can choose from a dedicated screen when you get the reward.

Season Pass is divided into <color=#95C7FF>seasons</color> at regular intervals. 
Once the season pass ends, you can no longer complete explorations.

Rewards for explorations that have already been completed can be received during the period
until the next season pass.

When the next Season Pass starts, if the rewards from the previous Season Pass have not
been claimed, all the available rewards will be automatically sent to the Gift Box.

If there were any unselected choice rewards, 
a reward will be automatically chosen from the available rewards and sent to the Gift Box.
